channel.title: Equation find pixel?
channel.description:
Not sure if this is actually possible, but let's give it a go.
If you're given a game floor coordinate, on a game screen (not including the square you're standing on, that extends 5 up, 5 down, 7 left, 7 right), any sort of equation/formula to calculate what pixel is in the center of said coordinate? The grid works as followed:
North of the player is (Y Coordinate -1) per square. South of the player is (Y Coordinate +1) per square. East of the player is (X Coordinate +1) per square West of the player is (X Coordinate -1)
Here's an example: [img]http://imageshack.us/a/img853/923/examplefi.jpg[/img] The red part represents the player. The X is where I need to calculate the pixel, based on the X, and Y coordinates.
Any help would be appreciated.

item.title: Equation find pixel?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

They Y value is just the y coordinate of tileCoordPx. There’s potentially an error in what I said above since it assumes the tiles are square.

Basically,
tileYPx = playerYPx + tileHeight * relCoord

relCoord is known (say, “5 spaces above”)
playerYPx is presumably known
tileHeight is calculated by screenHeight / numRowsOnScreen

So we find tileYPx, the pixel value of the center of the tile 5 spaces above you.

item.title: Equation find pixel?
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Am I missing something?

tileWidthPx = screenWidthPx / 11.0
tileCoordPx = playerCoordPx + tileWidthPx * relCoord

Where relCoord is a vector (4,3) in your example and playerCoordPx is the center (x, y) pixel coords of the player’s tile.
